intro: Knowltonia moorei, commonly known as the Moore's stiltroot, is a rare and endangered plant species native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic foliage and umbel-shaped inflorescences. The plant has a distinctive, tuberous root system that allows it to survive in dry conditions. Its flowers are typically white or pale pink, and it blooms in late spring to early summer. Due to habitat loss and overcollection, Knowltonia moorei is critically endangered and requires conservation efforts to ensure its survival.
